title: Bolivia (Plurinational State of) - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 4 February 2021, in Millares, Potosi, union transportation workers that work in the Sucre - Potosi route blocked three different points, as a demonstration to complain about being removed from the Potosi new bus terminal. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Oruro city, a group of odontology students staged a demonstration outside the Health Sciences Faculty building demanding the reduction of half of the tuition cost, due to the economic impact of the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Oruro city, students applicants that failed the entry exam for the Law and Economics courses of the Oruro Technical University (UTO) staged a demonstration outside the deans office's to demand a new test because of technical difficulties experienced during the exam. Police forces used tear gas to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Ascencion de Guarayos, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway on two places as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Cuatro Canadas, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in San Javier, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in San Julian, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway on two points and in Puente Banegas as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in San Pablo, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in San Ramon, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration, for the second consecutive day, to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Oruro city, hundreds of mining workers of 83 union groups of the Department Mining Unions (FEDECOMIN) marched through the city throwing firecrackers and dynamite sticks to the air, as a demonstration to demand national and local authorities reactivation of their work activities, after it was suspended due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=hundreds]

On 2 February 2021, in Ascencion de Guarayos, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway on two places as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in Cuatro Canadas, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in San Javier, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in San Pablo, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in San Ramon, Santa Cruz, transportation workers from Chiquitania region blocked the Santa Cruz-Beni highway as a demonstration to demand the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) authorities to repair said highway. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Epizana, Cochabamba, workers of companies outsourced by the Bolivian Highway Management (ABC) staged a demonstration demanding payment of owed salaries from the institution. Their salaries have been pending for five months. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Sacaba, Cochabamba, a group of parents of students of the city staged a demonstration outside the Hugo Chavez school, where the start of the new school year was being inaugurated by education authorities. They complained about the school not having all the required materials, internet services, and disinfection protocols to have in-person classes in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, a group of local merchants affected by a hail storm staged a demonstration in different areas of the city, to demand governmental aid. They claimed they needed help to deal with the destruction caused by the storm, which happened the month before. They said authorities promised to provide aid, but after a month they did not receive any type of support. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 29 January 2021, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) of the Cocapata city staged a demonstration outside the local government offices, for the third consecutive day, to reject the candidate for mayor chosen by the party. They claimed that the appointment of the candidate was biased. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 28 January 2021, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) of the Cocapata city staged a demonstration outside the local government offices for the second consecutive day, to reject the candidate for mayor chosen by the party. They claimed that the appointment of the candidate was biased. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of former police officers staged a demonstration outside the Department Command offices, to complain about the arbitrary reduction in the fund payments. They also complained about the lack of life insurance payment for the families of police officers who died from coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of health workers of the Oil Fund staged a demonstration outside the south Hospital of the city, to demand the government to declare lockdown due to the increasing deaths due to the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Oruro city, a group of workers of Avance de Obras municipal company staged a demonstration in the center of the city, to complain about not being provided with medical supplies to deal with the coronavirus pandemic, and demanding improvement in their working conditions. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 27 January 2021, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) of the Cocapata city staged a demonstration outside the local government offices, to reject the candidate for mayor chosen by the party. They claimed that the appointment of the candidate was biased. They entered the offices and detained 7 councilmen there. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 27 January 2021, in Sipe Sipe, Cochabamba, supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) of Cocapata municipality blocked Viloma bridge as a demonstration for the second consecutive day, to reject the candidate for mayor chosen by the party. They claimed that the appointment of the candidate was biased. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Ixiamas, La Paz, a group of workers of the San Buenaventura Sugar Company (EASBA) and of the Plural Economy and Development ministry blocked roads as a demonstration to demand the destitution of the manager of the state company. They claimed that the manager was treating poorly the workers, and that he was not efficient in his position. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, former private security workers of GIPS company blocked Blanco Galindo avenue, as a demonstration to demand payment of owed salaries and workers benefits that have been pending for more than 6 months, during the coronavirus pandemic lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of health workers of Obrero hospital staged a demonstration to demand health authorities to provide them with more medical supplies and to assign more doctors to deal with coronavirus patients. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 26 January 2021, in Sipe Sipe, Cochabamba, supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) of Cocapata municipality blocked Viloma bridge as a demonstration, to reject the candidate for mayor chosen by the party. Police forces intervened in the demonstration with tear gas, and dispersed them. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Palos Blancos, Tarija, a group of workers contributors of the Pension Fund Management (AFP) blocked the Bolivia-Argentina international highway, as a demonstration to demand the government to approve the 100% return of their funds. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in San Alberto, Tarija, a group of workers contributors of the Pension Fund Management (AFP) blocked the Bolivia-Argentina international highway, as a demonstration to demand the government to approve the 100% return of their funds. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Villamontes, Tarija, a group of workers contributors of the Pension Fund Management (AFP) blocked the Bolivia-Argentina international highway, near Bordo de Caiguami sector, as a demonstration to demand the government to approve the 100% return of their funds. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Yacuiba, Tarija, a group of workers contributors of the Pension Fund Management (AFP) blocked the Bolivia-Argentina international highway, near Algarrobal community, as a demonstration to demand the government to approve the 100% return of their funds. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, a group of citizens of K'ara K'ara sector blocked the city dump as a demonstration to demand contracts for doctors of the sector, water treatment processes, water subsidies and property rights to be given. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, a group of workers contributors of the Pension Fund Management (AFP) staged a demonstration to demand the government to approve the 100% return of their funds. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2021, near Rurrenabaque, Beni state, a group of residents and workers blocked the San Buenaventura-Rurrenabaque highway in a protest to demand the dismissal of the general manager of the San Buenaventura Sugar Company (EASBA). They claimed the manager mistreated workers and failed to implement important projects for the sector. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, in Villa Yapacani, Santa Cruz state, a group of people blocked the Santa Cruz-Cochabamba highway, as well as in the Yapacani and Sirari gas stations, in a protest demanding road pavement, the implementation of gas pumps, gas for domestic use and sewerage. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, in Sucre, Chuquisaca state, members of the Trufis Senor de Santiago Union blocked a road stretch near the Llinfi community. The reason behind the demonstration was not reported. A man tried to break the blockade and was beaten up and killed by two demonstrators. His injuries led to a heart attack. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2021, in La Paz, La Paz state, dozens of people gathered in Plaza Murillo demanding the full return of their contributions to the pension fund. [size=dozens]

On 20 January 2021, in El Alto, La Paz state, transport workers blocked several the 6 de Marzo avenue as a demonstration demanding at least 6 months of loan payment delays due to the economic impact of the coronavirus lockdown measures. This was the second day of protests. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in El Alto, La Paz state, transport workers blocked several the 6 de Marzo avenue as a demonstration demanding at least 6 months of loan payment delays due to the economic impact of the coronavirus lockdown measures. They also requested the resignation of the Minister of Economy, who they claim has outgrown the position. [size=no report]
On 18 January 2021, in Yacuiba, Tarija state, a group of transport workers blocked the Yacuiba-Santa Cruz highway demanding the return of their contributions to the pension fund. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, in Villa Yapacani, Santa Cruz state, a group of members of the Farmers and Intercultural Communities Union took control of Los Pozos plant and blocked the route that leads towards Yarara X1 dam, as a demonstration to demand construction of an asphalt highway. This was the sixth day of demonstrations. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Villa Yapacani, Santa Cruz, a group of members of the Farmers and Intercultural Communities Union took control of Los Pozos plant and blocked the route that leads towards Yarara X1 dam, as a demonstration to demand construction of an asphalt highway. This was the fifth day of demonstrations. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, a group of parents of students blocked a road in the city center and on the highway towards Oruro, to complain about the decision to cancel the delivery of school food baskets. They also complained about the quality of the products offered in the basket. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Villa Yapacani, Santa Cruz, a group of members of the Farmers and Intercultural Communities Union took control of Los Pozos plant and blocked the route that leads towards Yarara X1 dam, as a demonstration to demand construction of an asphalt highway. This was the fourth day of demonstrations. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Cotoca, Santa Cruz, transport workers blocked several streets and highways in the city, as a demonstration after the negotiations with government authorities, about delaying bank loan payments, fell through. They demanded at least 6 months of loan payment delays due to the economic impact of the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Warnes, Santa Cruz, transport workers blocked several streets and highways in the city, as a demonstration after the negotiations with government authorities, about delaying bank loan payments, fell through. They demanded at least 6 months of loan payment delays due to the economic impact of the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, a group of health brigadiers staged a demonstration outside the Medical Emergencies and Urgencies Regulating Center (CRUEM) offices, demanding contract stability for them, due to their work during the coronavirus lockdown measures. The brigadiers demonstrated after several health workers demonstrated the day before for the same reason but did not include them in the same contract renewals. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Villa Yapacani, Santa Cruz, a group of members of the Farmers and Intercultural Communities Union took control of Los Pozos plant and blocked the route that leads towards Yarara X1 dam, as a demonstration to demand construction of an asphalt highway. This was the first day of demonstrations. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, a group of doctors and administrative workers staged a demonstration outside the Medical Emergencies and Urgencies Regulating Center (CRUEM) offices, demanding contract stability for them, due to their work during the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2021, in Comarapa, Santa Cruz, a group of residents captured and withheld 15 police officers, as a demonstration to demand authorities justices on the death of a local car salesman that was killed and his body was found in Tiraque, Cochabamba. Police officers are being investigated as the culprits of the killing. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, dozens of parents of students blocked the entrances to Banco Union offices in 6 de Agosto avenue, as a demonstration for a second consecutive day, to complain that they are not given the school breakfast bonus because the payments had been suspended. [size=dozens]

On 8 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of citizens staged a vigil outside the Coca Leaf Producers Department Association (ADEPCOCA) offices in Villa Fatima sector, to protect the offices to be taken by Movement for Socialism (MAS) followers, that had attempted to do so the previous day. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 8 January 2021, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, around 150 members and supporters of Movement for Socialism (MAS) party clashed with health workers from the health center Health Fund of Caminos. The clash started when MAS members tried entering the offices and remove health workers from there, on the claims that they had been hired during the previous national government and should not be allowed to work anymore. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, dozens of locals staged a demonstration outside the South hospital, demanding for medical supplies to treat coronavirus patients and other patients, to be given to the hospital that they claimed had reduced over the passed weeks. [size=dozens]

On 7 January 2021, in La Paz city, members of the Neighborhood board unions of El Alto staged a demonstration in Murillo square, to demand the national government efficient and immediate attention from the hospitals assigned to treat coronavirus infected patients, that have stopped providing medical attention to these patients. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 7 January 2021, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, members and supporters of Movement for Socialism (MAS) party clashed with health workers from the health center Oil Industry Health Fund of Santa Cruz. The clash started when MAS members tried entering the offices and remove health workers from there, on the claims that they had been hired during the previous national government and should not be allowed to work anymore. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, a group of parents of students blocked the entrances to Banco Union offices in 6 de Agosto avenue, as a demonstration to complain that they are not given the school breakfast bonus because the payments had been suspended. [size=no report]
Farmers (Bolivia); MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 7 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of coca leaf farmers followers of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) tried to take control of the Coca Leaf Producers Department Association (ADEPCOCA) market in Villa Fatima. Farmers of the market and police forces clashed against the farmers followers of MAS who used explosives, and the officers tried to disperse them using tear gas. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, members of Revolutionary Human Action group burned down facemasks in the city, as a demonstration rejecting the use of facemasks as a measures to avoid coronavirus contagion, claiming that the facemasks worsens their health. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, in La Paz city, a group of doctors staged a demonstration in the city, demanding formal contracts for doctors working during the coronavirus lockdown measures and payment of owed wages during that time. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 3 January 2021, in Cochabamba city, a group of members of the Movement for Socialism (MAS), in the 9th District, staged a demonstration in the city to complain about the candidates selected for the local government elections. They claimed the appointment was biased to favor candidates from outside the 9th District jurisdiction. [size=no report]

On 3 January 2021, in Apolo, La Paz, a group of heavy transport workers blocked the roads leading towards the main square of the city, as a demonstration to complain about the delay of the reopening of La Paz-Charazani-Apolo highway. [size=no report]

Around 3 January 2021 (weekend of), in El Alto, La Paz, a group of citizens at a party captured and beat up 6 thieves who had entered the party, posing as invited guests, to steal from the attendees. Police forces later took the 6 thieves to the police station. [size=no report]

On 31 December 2020, in Tarija city, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in the Luis de Fuentes y Vargas square to reject the use of the coronavirus vaccine Sputnik V, as well as face masks in the country. The group claimed that there was no proof that the Russian Sputnik V vaccine was efficient and safe for human use. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 30 December 2020, in El Torno, Santa Cruz, members of social organizations from Tiquipaya and followers of Movement for Socialism (MAS), blocked a highway, claiming that the list of candidates elected were altered by the department and national authorities of MAS. The candidates were nominated to run for the upcoming subnational elections which will take place on 7 March 2021. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 30 December 2020, in Tiquipaya, Cochabamba, followers of Movement for Socialism (MAS) blocked a highway in the sector, claiming that the list of candidates elected were altered by the department and national authorities of MAS. The candidates were nominated to run for the upcoming subnational elections which will take place on 7 March 2021. They rejected the bias in selecting candidates without the MAS supporters' approval. [size=no report]

On 30 December 2020, in Oruro city, a group of citizens staged a demonstration outside the Municipal Collections offices, and blocked La Plata street, to demand the reopening of the institution, as their services were closed for end of the year reports. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, a group of parents of students blocked the main highway towards Oruro, for a second consecutive day, demanding the immediate delivery of the food baskets offered as compensation from the budget allocated to the school breakfast, which has been suspended during the coronavirus pandemic. They claimed that the food basket deliveries were delayed. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, in El Alto, La Paz, a group of transport drivers staged a demonstration, complaining that the local government presumably gives preference to transport drivers from La Paz instead of providing them with new spaces for their work. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, a group of small business owners staged a demonstration in the city against the local government decision of banning all parties and events during the end of the year holidays, due to the coronavirus sanitary and lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, a group of parents of students blocked the main highway towards Oruro, demanding the immediate delivery of the food baskets offered as compensation from the budget allocated to the school breakfast, which has been suspended during the coronavirus pandemic. They claimed that the food basket deliveries were delayed. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 28 December 2020, in Montero, Santa Cruz, followers of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) clashed against each other in front of the Department Electoral Tribunal (TED) offices. A group was against the candidates chosen by the MAS authorities to contest the upcoming subnational elections on 7 March 2021. They attempted to stop the registration of the candidates claiming that the department authorities had changed the candidates to represent the party. The other group supported the decision of the authorities for the candidates. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 28 December 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, followers of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) divided clashed against each other in front of the Department Electoral Tribunal (TED) offices. A group was against the candidates chosen by the MAS authorities to contest the upcoming subnational elections on 7 March 2021. They attempted to stop the registration of the candidates claiming that the department authorities had changed the candidates to represent the party. The other group supported the decision of the authorities for the candidates. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 28 December 2020, in Potosi city, at least 8000 Movement for Socialism (MAS) followers staged a demonstration outside the Department Electoral Tribunal (TED) in two groups, one supporting the formalization of the candidate elected by MAS movement authorities to the upcoming subnational elections, expected to take place on 7 March 2021. On 10 November 2020, in Warnes, Santa Cruz, Movement for Socialism (MAS) supporters of the former mayor and the newly appointed mayor of the city, both from MAS, clashed in the main square of the city against each other due to a conflict by the former mayor who disowns the decision of the municipal council and claiming she is still mayor. Several injured citizens were reported, including a journalist. [size=no report]

On 9 November 2020, in Cochabamba city, workers of Prosil company staged a demonstration demanding payment of owed salaries during the coronavirus pandemic lockdown measures and complaining about unjustified layoffs. [size=no report]

On 9 November 2020, in La Paz city, a clash was reported between groups of citizens who are disputing the control of the Neighborhood Boards Federation (FEJUVE). The offices of FEJUVE were destroyed, an unknown number of citizens were injured and around 10 people were arrested. [size=no report]

On 9 November 2020, in La Paz city, civil organizations from El Alto staged a demonstration in Murillo square demanding representation of their citizens in charge of a ministry in the government of Luis Arce. [size=no report]

On 9 November 2020, in Tupiza, Potosi, a group of citizens blocked the highway to stop the motorcade celebrating the return of the former president Evo Morales,. They also demanded school supplies to be given to them with the budget assigned for the school breakfast, which have been paused due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples; Farmers (Bolivia)

On 8 November 2020, in La Paz city, a group of coca leaf farmers supporters of the Movement for Socialism (MAS) took violently control of the Coca Producers Department Association (ADEPCOCA) offices in Villa Fatima sector with iron sticks, dynamite and other objects, and attacked the workers of the offices and attempted to force them to kiss the flag of their political party. [size=no report]

MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 8 November 2020, in La Paz (La Paz), Luis Alberto Arce Catacora of the Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples (MAS-IPSP) was sworn in as the President of Bolivia in the Presidential Palace in La Paz, ending one year of the interim government of the Social Democratic Movement (MDS).

This was the fourth day of demonstrations in the sector. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, in La Paz city, a mutiny from prisoners was reported in San Pedro prison, in which the prisoners climbed to the roof, carrying placards denouncing the former director of Penitentiary Regime. Prisoners claimed he was a defamer and a coward, because of his declarations in which he claimed that police forces were responsible in letting prisoners leave the prison at nights to commit delinquent acts. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, in Sipe Sipe, Cochabamba, the school boards of parents of students staged a demonstration in the Municipal Council main offices to a dialogue of the food provision to schools. They claimed that the Council had denied receiving them and suddenly changing the hours of audiences to deal with items with teachers. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, more than 100 sanitation workers from the Quillacollo Municipal Cleaning Company (EMAQ) staged a demonstration demanding the payment of their wagers from January and the destitution of 3 public authorities for blocking the workers rehiring, implementing more requisites for workers hired. [size=more than 100]

On 12 February 2020, in Yacuiba, Tarija, a group of beekeepers blocked route 9 that connects Yacuiba with Santa Cruz as a demonstration to denounce national authorities of negotiating with some beekeepers in Santa Cruz and trying to divide them. They demanded the purchase of 50 tons of their production at a fair prices by the Bolivian Food Company (EBA). [size=no report]

On 11 February 2020, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, a group of followers of the Creemos alliance and Luis Frenando Camacho (MNR) were starting their political campaign in the center of the city, when they were surrounded by a group of citizens that demanded them to leave the sector. Police forces had to intervene to avoid any confrontations between both sides. 2 people were arrested. [size=no report]

On 10 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, a group of 60 workers from the Municipal Parking service (SEM) staged a demonstration in Colon street, Venezuela street and Mexico street. They demanded to be paid their wages that had been owed for 3 months, the resignation of their supervisor and the leveling of paying scales that would be a rise of 50% in wages. [size=60]

On 7 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, free transport workers blocked the San Martin and Honduras avenues intersection to reject the lack of interest of authorities to fulfil their demands and to check the Municipal ordinance 4195 to see if they can operate in the sector. [size=no report]

On 7 February 2020, in Yacuiba, Tarija, civics of Tarija staged a demonstration by blocking the international highway that connects Bolivia with Argentina, to demand the government the fulfillment of law 3058 that establishes the installment of the vice-presidency of Management, Control and supervision of YPFB in Gran Chaco. [size=no report]

On 7 February 2020, in Yacuiba, Tarija, for the second consecutive day, small businesses owners staged a demonstration by blocking the international highway that connects Bolivia with Argentina, 8 km away from the city,  to reject the return of the Gas Company of Tarija (EMTAGAS) and to continue the state operations of TPFB as distributor and installer of ducts and connections of gas in the region. [size=no report]

On 7 February 2020, in Tiquipaya, Cochabamba, citizens of 3 districts that oppose the construction of a water treatment plant in Bruno Moqo Territorial Base Organization (OTB) staged a demonstration by blocking the main entrances to the municipality to demand the execution of more impact projects in their communities. They demonstrated in front of the Mayor's office and demanded the resignation of the mayor of the municipality. [size=no report]

On 7 February 2020, in Villamontes, Tarija, citizens of Tarija staged a demonstration by blocking the international highway that connects Bolivia with Argentina, to demand the government the fulfillment of law 3058 that establishes the installment of the vice-presidency of Management, Control and supervision of YPFB in Gran Chaco. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, women collectives marched in the Cala Cala square to reject the actions of the irregular group Cochala Youth Resistance (RJC), that had evicted a group of women from the plaza weeks before. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, environmentalists staged a demonstration against the construction of human settlements in the protected  Tunari National Park (PNT), claiming that the Supreme Decree 12301 states that there cannot be any colonization in parks and natural reserves. The demonstration was staged after citizens living in the 2750 sector had staged a demonstration to demand the planimetry to be approved for urbanization and electricity to be installed in their settlement. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2020, in Sacaba, Cochabamba, citizens of several Territorial Base Organizations (OTB) staged a demonstration to demand the execution of more projects in their towns. They concentrated in front of the Municipal Council offices to make their claims. The claims are not detailed in the report. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2020, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, citizens summoned by the Special Force to Fight Violence (FELCV) and the president Jeanine Anez marched in the center of the city streets against the number of femicides and infanticides registered in the country during the year. They motivated people from all ages to denounce violence. [size=no report]

On 6 February 2020, in Yacuiba, Tarija, small businesses owners staged a demonstration by blocking the international highway that connects Bolivia with Argentina, 8 km away from the city, to reject the return of the Gas Company of Tarija (EMTAGAS) and to continue the state operations of TPFB as distributor and installer of ducts and connections of gas in the region. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2020, in Tarija city, more than 300 health workers marched towards the Governance offices of Tarija demanding transparency in the distribution of items given by the Health Ministry, which they are accusing of not giving items they mentioned first, no information available on the distribution of items and being biased politically to whom they give the items. [size=more than 300]

On 5 February 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, Workers from the Department Central Labor (COD) of Chuquisaca marched to 25 de Mayo square complaining about the lack of unity from political parties and claiming that they are only opportunists and traitors. Additionally, they also demonstrated demanding the next authorities to recover the royalties from the Incahuasi mining camp, the reactivation of the Juan Azurduy airport and guarantee resources for water projects. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, union members of the Farmer's market in the sector staged a demonstration in 25 de Mayo square to demand more attention from the Intendency to implement more controls to informal merchants in the sector. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, around 10.000 neighbors of the 16th district staged a demonstration in front of the mayor's office demanding more sewer systems and attempted to take control of the water treatment plant of Albarrancho. The demonstrators claimed that they have not implemented sewer systems in the sector for 30 years and that the water is not adequately treated. [size=around 10,000]

On 4 February 2020, in Monteagudo, Chuquisaca, Honey producers of Chuquisaca blocked route 9 that connects Yacuiba with Santa Cruz and took control of a factory of the Bolivian Food Company (EBA) as a demonstration to demand that the purchase of their production be resumed. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2020, in Tiquipaya, Cochabamba, citizens of at least 13 Base Territorial Organizations (OTB) staged a demonstration in Tiquipaya square in front of the municipality main offices, to demand to the mayor the implementation of relevant projects. Additionally, they demonstrated against the water treatment plant in the sector and because of the unsatisfactory accountability report given by the mayor, that does not cover the expectations of the neighbors. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, a group of citizens living in the 2750 sector of Tunari National Park (PNT) staged a demonstration and attempted to take the administrative offices of the protected area. They demand the destitution of the administrative manager because of blocking processes like electric power being installed and blocking the approval of planimetry of legal urbanizations in the sector. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2020, in Cochabamba city, a group of workers of the Municipal company Green Areas and Alternative Recreation (EMAVRA) marched around the 14 de Septiembre square, in front of the mayor's office, to demand the signing of contracts to reactivate the institution and the payments of social benefits that have been owed for 9 months. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, a vigil was held by neighbors of the 6th, 7th and 8th districts from Oropeza Primera province in front of the Guereo Palaca to demand the officialization of the sub-mayors that had to be designated by entity, but have not been approved. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2020, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, dozens of workers from 147 companies that are part of the Gas Installation Companies of Santa Cruz association (ADEIGAS) staged a demonstration against the administration of Santa Cruz Gas Networks of Bolivian Fiscal Oil Fields (YPFB) demanding the payment for services provided for 4 months. [size=dozens]

On 2 February 2020, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, citizens summoned by the Santa Cruz committee against the lack of unity between presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential elections staged a demonstration and a meeting to decide further demonstrations. However, some citizens were supporting different presidential candidates, and the meeting could not reach an agreement. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, members of citizen platforms staged a demonstration in front of Casa de la Libertad, to demand political movements to step aside from the presidential elections and to join together to avoid vote dispersion and to avoid favoring the MAS movement. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, transport workers blocked the entrance of the Bolivian Highway Administration (ABC) to demand the finishing of the construction of the Epizana - Valle Hermoso highway and the old highway that connects Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. Additionally, they demanded the owed wages since September by the Company Dell'Acqua that was in charge of construction of the Epizana - Valle Hermoso, who had hired them for transport services. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, parents and tutors of children with autism demanded the government to guarantee their inclusion and denounced that there is a lack of vigilance and bullying against children with this disorder in normal schools, because of there not being a specialized center for attending these kind of disorders. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2020, in Patacamaya, La Paz, a group of citizens destroyed a police unit and injured police officers after they intervened in a traffic accident. A lieutenant was injured and taken to a hospital, but there is an unknown number of injured police officers. A Police coronel mentioned that the people who did those things were drunk. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 29 January 2020, in La Paz city, the leader of National Unity movement was assaulted by a group of MAS movement followers who intercepted him in Ingavi and Genaro Sanjines streets near the State Attorney offices, and started to hit him and lash out against him. He was able to run from the location to safety. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2020, in Panduro sector, located in Sica Sica, La Paz, around 50 to 70 citizens of Eucaliptus municipality blocked the Oruro-La Paz highway to reject the attempt of the former mayor of returning to his position. [size=around 50 to 70]

On 24 January 2020, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, a massive number of transport workers marched towards the Secretary of Accounting (SER) offices to demonstrate against the Urban Mobility law. [size=a massive number]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 22 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, followers of the MAS movement and citizen platforms marched through the city to Simon Bolivar Square to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples; Government of Bolivia (2019-2020)

On 22 January 2020, in Potosi city, around 100 followers of the MAS movement and citizen platforms marched through the city to Simon Bolivar Square to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state. The governor of the region participated in the event. [size=around 100]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 22 January 2020, in San Julian, Santa Cruz, followers of the MAS movement and citizen platforms marched through the city to Simon Bolivar Square to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, followers of the MAS movement, social movement members and Coca Leaf Federation members marched through the city in the sector of Pucara to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state. The former president Evo Morales gave a message through telephone to their followers. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 22 January 2020, in El Alto, La Paz, neighbors ans supporters of the MAS-IPSP party of the 8th District of the city marched through the city to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state and to tribute people that were injured or killed during the post electoral conflict of October. They demanded the government to fulfil the peace agreements that were signed with the districts of the city to manage and finish the pending projects. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 22 January 2020, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, followers of the MAS movement and citizen platforms marched through the city to Simon Bolivar Square to celebrate the anniversary of the Plurinational state. There are reports of fights with demonstrators against the MAS political movement. Police forces intervened in the fights and 6 people were arrested. [size=at least 6]

On 22 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, more than 100 workers from around 60 outsourcing companies blocked the 6 de Agosto Avenue as a demonstration to demand the payment of salaries that have been owed for more than half a year. They demanded the conflict between companies and institutions to be solved. [size=more than 100]
On 21 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, dozens of university students and citizens staged a march through the city against femicides in the region. [size=dozens]

On 20 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, neighbors of San Juan de Dios bajo sector blocked Circunvalacion Avenue as a demonstration to demand the Municipality to repair the bridge that connects with the center of the city, improvement of nearby roads and pedestrian accesses, and a contention wall and purification of the Quirpinchaca river. The demonstration was triggered after a boy drowned in the river near their neighborhood. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, a hundred neighbors from Alto Cobol staged a demonstration in front of the Municipality main offices, demanding the planimetry of the Base Territorial Organization (OTB) of their neighborhood and attention to their park's lights. They burned objects in front of the main offices and they demanded a meeting to negotiate with the Mayor. [size=a hundred]

On 19 January 2020, in Warnes, Santa Cruz, more than 300 workers of La Belgica sugar company blocked the highway that leads towards Montera in the roundabout in the south of the city to demand the release of 11 workers that were arrested by the police after the demands they had made for late payments. [size=more than 300]
On 18 January 2020, in La Paz city, dozens of men supported by women staged a demonstration in the city rejecting the femicides and violence against women. [size=dozens]

On 18 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, more than 300 workers blocked the highway Sucre-Santa Cruz to demand the Bolivian Highways Authority (ABC) to fulfil the payments to the company Villa Creces Andrade that was in charge of the expansion and maintenance of the Villa Granado-Puente Taperas section. They claimed that they had not been paid since July of 2019. [size=more than 300]

On 17 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, almost 30 workers blocked the Villa Granado-Puente Taperas section in the Sucre-Santa Cruz highway to demand the Administradora Boliviana de Carreteras (ABC) to fulfil the payments to the company Villa Creces Andrade that was in charge of the expansion and maintenance of the Villa Granado-Puente Taperas section. They claimed that they had not been paid for 6 months. [size=almost 30]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On 17 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, activists staged a demonstration in front of Evo Morales coliseum to reject the precandidate of MAS. Later that day clashes started after activists from Cascos Amarillos, Resistencia Juvenil, Jovenes Patrioras, Juventud Charcas, Mujeres fuertes arrived to the sector. No injured were reported. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, family members of femicide and infanticide victims staged a demonstration in front of the Justice Palace of the city, to demand authorities to give priority and faster processing to these cases, since some of the demonstrators mentioned that their processes have been paralyzed for more than a year. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2020, in El Puente, Santa Cruz, onion farmers staged a demonstration by blocking the borders of the city and the route to nearby Carreras municipality to demand the stop of products that enter the country from Peru so that their products are sold at a fair price. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, civic group members and activists staged a demonstration in front of the Plurinational Constitutional Court (TCP) to demand the magistrates to have a statement made about the nullity action of the reelection judgement, and the extension of the mandate of Congress elected authorities and the president Jeanine Anez. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, a group of merchants of La Cancha market blocked the surrounding streets of 14 de Septiembre plaza that includes the entrance to the municipality as a demonstration against the eviction of their work spaces. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2020, in Tiquipaya, Cochabamba, neighbors of the sector staged a demonstration by blocking the Khora bridge. They demanded the mayor to repair the structure of the bridge, claiming that it is in a bad state and it represents a danger to the population. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, around twenty activists members of Women for Bolivia and Unete staged a demonstration by marching from 14 de Septiembre plaza until Las Banderas plaza. They were against the Constitutional Guarantee Law that was approved by the senator's chambers on Friday January 10 2020, that they claimed is discriminatory, unequal and biased. The law aims to protect the rights of social and political leaders who are in the country or abroad.[size=around 20]

On 12 January 2020, in Uyuni, Potosi, workers staged a demonstration against the new manager of the Bolivian Lithium Deposits (YLB) by blocking the streets near the main offices. The demonstrators mention that they do not want a manager, they want to administer the lithium and the company. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, close to 80 health workers staged a demonstration in front of the SEDES offices in the sector, claiming the new contracts of 2020 did not become effective in January, like in previous years. They claimed that the amount of health workers are not enough to cover all the work shifts and they were alarmed by the absence of the new contracts. [size=close to 80]

On 9 January 2020, in Cochabamba city, neighbors of the OTB Pirai Park of the 6 District staged a demonstration to reject the return of the administration to the land in which a bus station was constructed, because of the increase of garbage and vermin in the sector caused by the pause in construction and the land not being used. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2020, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, parents of students of the Don Bosco school staged a demonstration in front of the Department Education Administration in the city, to demand the respective authorities a faster process, that has been carried since April 2019, against the former dean of the school who was accused of selling job positions. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2020, in Yaguacua, Tarija, citizens of Yaguacua, Sachapera, Las Abras and Sanadita Viejo communities staged a demonstration in the city by blocking the main highway that connects Santa Cruz with Argentina, close to the Thermoelectric factory of the south. They demanded authorities the rotation of personnel and that the electricity generator factory called Ende to open job positions for people of the sector. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2020, in Yacuiba, Tarija, students recently graduated from high school and Nursing students staged a demonstration by blocking the main highway that connects Santa Cruz with Argentina, in the university Juan Misael Saracho campus in the Limitas community. They demanded the presence of the dean of the university for him to guarantee the start of enrollment of new students for the Nursing career and stability to the current students in that subject. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2020, in La Paz city, representatives of citizen platforms and activists staged a demonstration outside the residence of the Mexican Embassy to demand justice and respect to the sovereignty of the country. The Mexican embassy had hosted people aligned to the former president who were accused of terrorism, and other crimes during the demonstrations held in October and November 2019 after the results of the presidential elections that placed Evo Morales as the winner. [size=no report]

On 2 January 2020, in La Paz city, neighbors and a group of citizens called La Resistencia staged a demonstration outside the house of the Mexican ambassador, located in La Rinconada at the south of the city, that was housing 9 former ministers of the previous government. The demonstrators claimed that they would not allow former ministers of Evo Morales to leave from that space because of their pending accountabilities with the justice of the country. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2019, in Cabezas, Santa Cruz, health workers from the sector staged a demonstration by blocking the main highway Santa Cruz - Camiri, to demand payment from the municipality for 3 months of their work. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, patients being treated for cancer in the Instituto Chuquisaqueno de Oncologia staged a demonstration by marching in the streets around the institute, to show their support of the entity's administrator, defending her and demanding her to stay in charge of the institute. The administrator had been denounced by an assembly woman of abusing and humiliating medical personnel in the institute. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2019, in Parotani, Cochabamba, farmers of the low valley of the sector staged a demonstration by blocking and throwing their products near the Parotani bridge, to demand the borders control and closure, to control the entrance of contraband vegetables that are entering the sector from Peru and Argentina. [size=no report]

On 19 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, Cochala Youth Resistance members staged a demonstration in front of the Department Legislative Assembly offices during the election of electoral authorities. During the demonstration, they assaulted journalists that were in the sector covering the event. [size=no report]

On 19 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, a group of students of Universidad Mayor de San Simon staged a demonstration in the dean's office in Ballivian avenue, demanding the resignation of the dean, that had renounced his position after the post electoral crisis and returned to his position a month later. They claimed his return is illegal. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, family members and friends of the governor of Chuquisaca, who is in protective custody for the crime of abandonment of functions, misuse of state goods and services, among other crimes, staged a demonstration outside the department State attorney offices to demand his release. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, citizens marched to demand the annulment of the selection process of new members for the TED of the department. They claimed that the selection process is favoring people that are related to the MAS political party. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, more than a dozen of construction companies representatives staged a demonstration in the Secretaria de Finanzas y Contaduria offices of the local government, to demand the payment of debts owed to them since 2018. They asked the local council members to intervene with the local government for them to be able to pay their workers and debts. [size=more than a dozen]

On 16 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, citizens of La Maica captured two presumed thieves and they attempted to lynch them. Police forces intervened and took the presumed thieves before they were assaulted. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2019, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, neighbors and citizens of Rancho Chico blocked the old Santa Cruz-Cochabamba routes as a demonstration to demand the Highways administrative to install speed reducers in the highway because of the increase of accidents in the sector. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2019, in Potosi city, mining workers staged a demonstration against the Tribunal Constitucional Plurinacional demanding the fulfilment of a ruling that ordered their reinstatement to their work positions after 4 years of an unjustified dismissal. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, neighbors and social leaders of the OTB Beato Salomon, in District 2, gathered in the Intendencia in Calampampa avenue. They demanded the Mayor of the city to give them back that property were the Intendencia was, where they organized their activities at the end of the year. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2019, in Puerto Villarroel, Cochabamba, a group of citizens captured two men who had presumably stolen a car in Valle Sacta sector. They both were tied up to a tree and were beaten up. One of them was tied to a tree with poisonous ants, and because of the beating and the ant bites, he had a heart attack and died. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, feminist collectives and citizens gathered at 25 de Mayo plaza to disavow the impunity in rape cases in the city. They performed 'A rapist in your path' (performance from women's groups against gender-based violence). [size=no report]

On 7 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, a group of women staged a demonstration because of harassment suffered from the representative of a NGO called Voces Libres. The demonstrators mentioned that they were forced to work in the confectionary sector for more than 12 hours, they have not been paid for 2 months, and they were insulted by the representative and the secretary. They demanded respect and regulation of the NGO. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2019, in La Paz city, citizens staged a demonstration in front of the Legislative Assembly to reject the approval of a law project that gives protection to elected authorities and syndicate leaders. The demonstrators claimed that this is an attempt to give former president Evo Morales immunity so he can come back to the country and to syndical leaders that were the reason of conflicts in the previous month. [size=no report]

On 5 December 2019, in Quillacollo, Cochabamba, members of two transport lines that operate in the city started a fight in the zone of El Pazo, because members of one line invaded the route of the other transport line. Both group of workers started a clash. Police forces were able to stop the confrontations with chemical agents. There are reports of injured people but no information of how many. [size=no report]

On 5 December 2019, in Cochabamba city, during the arrival of the president of the Comite Civico Potonista (COMCIPO), two groups of students, one in favour of the president of the committee, and one against, clashed. Stones and other objects were thrown between both demonstrator groups, which left 1 student injured. Additionally, a journalist that was present during the clash of the students was also injured by the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 4 December 2019, in Plaza 14 de Septiembre, Cochabamba, more than 3,000 merchants of the Christmas fair marched as a demonstration in 6 de Agosto avenue until 14 de Septiembre plaza to demand the municipal counsel to stop emitting resolutions that allows more merchants to sell their products in other streets of the city. [size=more than 3,000]

On 3 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, neighbors of Quillacollo staged a demonstration to demand the Tribunal Constitucional Plurinacional the revocation of a resolution dictated by a judge that favored a man who, according to the demonstrators, intends to appropriate 25 hectares of land, where there are already houses of families and using false documentation. On 3 December 2019, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz, citizens users of the Cooperativa Rural de Electrificacion (CRE) staged a demonstration outside the main offices of the CRE in rejection of an increase of the electric bill costs. On 3 December 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, Journalists of the region staged a demonstration in the offices of the Central Obrera Departamental (COD) against the main director of the press confederation of this entity, because he is aligned with the MAS movement and to have been reelected in an irregular fashion. On 27 November 2019, in Cochabamba city, a group of demonstrators took control pacifically the facilities of the Defensoria del Pueblo to demand the resignation of the person in charge and the representative of the entity because of showing no impartiality in the analysis of previous demonstrations against and in favor of Evo Morales that took place in the city. On 26 November 2019, in Cochabamba city, a group of students of the Universidad Mayor de San Simon took forcedly control of the vice dean offices to demand the fulfillment of 4 points, in which they demanded the unknowledgement of the newly assigned dean. Also, they demanded free summer classes for all faculties, and the vice dean to assume the role of dean of the university. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2019, in Cochabamba city, hundreds of demonstrators in favor and against Evo Morales concentrated in front of the Defensoria del Pueblo offices while there was a meeting with the Interamerican Human Rights Commission that had come to observe the situation of human rights in the country. The demonstrators both yelled against and in favor Evo Morales (MAS-IPSP) and the government of Jeanine Anez (Social Democratic Movemebt). Some shoving and insults were reported, by it was controlled by police forces in the sector. [size=hundreds]

On 25 November 2019, near Cochabamba city, demonstrators blocking the highway Oruro - Cochabamba threw rocks at buses and trucks in the sector, damaging windshields and windows. No injured were reported. The highways were blocked by people supporters of MAS that continued their demonstrations in favor of former president Evo Morales. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2019, in Sucre, Chuquisaca, citizens staged a demonstration with a peaceful march in the 25 de Mayo plaza. The marched moved from the center of the city, and concentrated in Casa de la Libertad. Representatives of Evangelic churches participated in the march asking for peace in the country. [size=no report]
MAS-IPSP: Movement for Socialism - Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples

On February 12 2019, during a Inter American commission for human rights meeting in Sucre, activists of the 21F movement in Bolivia verbally confronted members of social organizations that were in favour of the current regime. The protests between them did not spark into any violent behaviour, only a verbal discussion between both sides.

On February 12 2019, civic organizations blocked the main highway that connects to Brazil in San Jose de Chiquitos in protest of the time it was taken for the start of construction of a new highway offered by the government of San Jose de Chiquitos. It's been more than 6 months since the contract was signed and the construction has not started. Protesters demanded answers on the chronogram established for this project.

On February 11 2019, citizens of Cochabamba protested against the proposal of an route that would affect different education institutions and a garden. The protesters blocked the bridge Muyurina demanding a change.

On February 11 2019, for a fifth day, students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. They took possession of the offices of the university in demonstration to demand that the tuition does not go up.

On February 10 2019, for a fourth day, students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. They took possession of the offices of the university in demonstration to demand that the tuition does not go up.

On February 9 2019, for a third day, students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. They took possession of the offices of the university in demonstration to demand that the tuition does not go up.

On February 8 2019, citizens and family members of Oruro protested about the lack of attention from the government about the rehabilitation and health care of people that suffered deadly injuries last year. They complained that the government has not taken responsibility about this event.

On February 8 2019, for a third day, students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. They took possession of the offices of the university in demonstration to demand that the tuition does not go up.

On February 8 2019, protesters gathered in Sucre in Plaza 25 de Mayo to show their claims of worries about the lack of respect from the government to the decision made in the referendum that would not let Evo Morales be reelected as president. The protest was done for the members of the Inter-American Commision on Human Rights to call their attention to this case.

On February 8 2019, protesters members of a Indigenous group protested in Potosi after the march started in Sucre, with their final destination to la Paz to protest about the mining companies that have been given privileges to perform operations in Sucre and other sectors. The march has been called the 'Marcha por tierras'.

On February 7 2019, for a second day, students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. They took possession of the offices of the university to demand that the tuition does not go up.

On February 6 2019, protesters members of a Indigenous group protested in Sucre in a march towards la Paz and other parts of Bolivia to complain about the mining companies that have been given privileges to perform operations in the area.

On February 5 2019, Students demonstrated violently against the increase of tuition in San Francisco Xavier University in Sucre. The students burned down 2 offices of the administrative sector of the university and had threw firecrackers and other types of explosives towards teachers and university authorities. They have currently taken possession of the offices of the university in demonstration. No one was injured.

On 5 February 2019, teachers and health workers protested in La Paz demanding respect for the results of the February 21 referendum and to protest against the Unique Health System program implemented by the government and forced retirement announced by the president.
On February 1 2019, workers protested in Normandia, in Santa Cruz, demanding that authorities to control the informal merchants in the sectors that have invaded space assigned for formal merchants.

On February 1 2019, different syndicates of health workers protested in La Paz against the inclusion of the Unique Health System that has been promoted by the government, in which they increase the age for retiring from work. They additionally demanded that the decision of the referendum of the 21 of February of 2016 in which people voted they did not want Evo Morales to run again as president.

On February 1 2019, citizens of Quillacollo protested against the local government about land use and conflict of interests by the governor. They protested about the damages this actions cause on their works and lives.

On February 1 2019, the group of unemployed mining workers that were protesting against the government and demanding for more jobs available for them were violently suppressed by police forces in Plaza Murillo in La Paz. The Police forces used tear gas and pushed the protesters to evict them from the Plaza. This was the second time police were violent against the protesters in this cause.

On January 31 2019, teachers, health workers and other groups protested in La Paz to demand more funding for sectors like education and health instead of using part of the budget to maintain the public image of Evo Morales.

On January 31 2019, merchants from Cochabamba protested, demanding the resignation of the person in charge of site allocation in the sector. They claimed they were being charged irregular fees for their paperwork to be approved and that the person in charge is abusing of its power.

On January 30 2019, The group of unemployed mining workers that were protesting against the government and demanding for more jobs to be available for them were violently suppressed by Police Forces in Plaza Murillo in La Paz. The Police forces used tear gas and pushed the protesters to evict them from the Plaza. The protesters had no choice to move out of the area.

On January 29 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the 13th day of protest

On January 29 2019, military forces were trying to stop a contraband group in La Paz were attacked by rioters of the sector protecting the group. This turned into street fighting in which the rioters used firecrackers and explosives to attack the military forces. Military forces had to shoot their weapons in which one rioter was left injured.

On January 28 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the 12th day of protest

On January 28 2019, Students of University of Sucre protested against the increase in tuition by their university. They protested because the increase is substantial and it becomes difficult for the students to pay those prices.

On January 27 2019, citizens and organized groups protested against the primary elections carried out on the same day in Plaza Abaroa in La Paz. The demonstrators were against the decision to let Evo Morales run for re-election in defiance of the February 12, 2016 referendum. The demonstrators encouraged people not to vote in the primaries.

On January 27 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the 11th day of protest

On January 27 2019, Citizens and organized groups protested against the primary elections carried out on the same day in Plaza 24 de Septiembre in Santa Cruz. The demonstrators were against the decision to let Evo Morales run for re-election in defiance of the February 12, 2016 referendum. The demonstrators encouraged people not to vote in the primaries.

On January 27 2019, Venezuelan immigrants living in Bolivia protested in Santa Cruz against the Venezuelan government regime of Nicolas Maduro. They recognize Juan Guaido as their constitutional president and demand new elections in Venezuela.

On January 27 2019, citizens and organized groups protested against the primary elections carried out on the same day in Plaza 14 de Septiembre en Cochabamba. The demonstrators were against the decision to let Evo Morales run for re-election in defiance of the February 12, 2016 referendum. The demonstrators encouraged people not to vote in the primaries.

On January 27 2019, Venezuelan immigrants living in Bolivia protested in Cochabamba against the venezuelan government regime of Nicolas Maduro. They recognize Juan Guaido as their constitutional president and demand new elections in Venezuela.

On January 27 2019, Venezuelan immigrants living in Bolivia protested in La Paz against the Venezuelan government of Nicolas Maduro. They recognize Juan Guaido as their constitutional president and demand new elections in Venezuela.

On January 26 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the tenth day of protest

On January 25 2019, Family members of cancer patients protested against the government because of the lack of treatment given by the hospital, because of the lack of supplies given by the government. The protests happened in Santa Cruz de la Sierra.

On January 25 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the ninth day of protest. [size=no report]

On January 25 2019, citizens of Cochabamba demanded the resignation of the sub-mayor and that the economic resources of the previous 3 local governments be given back. They explained that the municipality halted projects and did not pay them for their respective work.

On January 25 2019, citizens of Sacaba protested against the corruption cases that are being investigated by the district attorney and that have affected the tax revenue of the local government. They demanded that the members investigated to be sent to jail.

On January 24 2019, citizens of el Dorado in Santa Cruz de la Sierra protested against the empty lots around the sector that they consider as a hazard to security and health. The demonstrators demanded that the localgovernment find the owners of the lots to force them to clean them and control invasions.

On January 24 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the eighth day of protest

On 23 January 2019, transport workers went on strike and protested by blocking urban transport in Oruro, complaining about different works and authorities that transport workers syndicates do not agree with. They had previously established a deal, however transport workers complained about not everyone agreeing with the decisions some syndicates had made with the government.

On January 23 2019, students protested in Sucre against the possible decision on charging the debt left by the previous financial head of University San Francisco Xavier de Chuquisaca. They protested against the university transferring the cost of the debt onto their tuition rates.

On January 23 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the seventh day of protest

On January 22 2019, protests in defense of the referendum results in Bolivia of the 21st of February of 2016 in which people expressed that they did not approve Evo Morales to run again as president and voting for alternating power. The protest was carried out in La Paz.

On January 22 2019, citizens of El Alto protested by not allowing people or public workers to enter the landfill of Alpacoma. They demanded a new solution for this landfill that has become a hazard for the health of surrounding neighbors. This was the sixth day of protest.

On January 21 2019, protests against the reelection of Evo Morales happened in Sucre, where protesters claimed that they would continue to protest to protect the results of the referendum carried out February 21st 2016. They demanded that the government and the electoral power must respect the results of the referendum.

On January 21 2019, protests against the reelection of Evo Morales happened in Cochabamba, where protesters claimed that they would continue to protest to protect the results of the referendum carried out February 21st 2016. On January 18 2019, a group of 300 unemployed of Huanuni protested on front of the Vice President's office in La Paz to have a meeting with Evo Morales that would let them be rehired into mining jobs. They marched towards la Paz for a week.

On January 18 2019, workers in Cochabamba protested against the company Sinohydro because they do not have adequate conditions of nutrition and housing. This protest was considered illegal as it goes against the general labor law and the supreme decree 224.

On January 17 2019, a group of 300 unemployed of Huanuni protested by marching towards la Paz to demand the government rehire them as employees with the mining company that operates in the region. This day they reached El Alto and la Paz to the president's office.

On January 17 2019, citizens of La Paz blocked the entrance to the landfill of La Paz called Alpacoma in protest, demanding that the municipality to close this landfill that has created several landslides around the sector and other problems.

On January 15 2019, a group of 300 unemployed people from Huanuni protested by marching towards la Paz to demand the government rehire them as employees with the mining company that operates in the region. In this date, they reached Ayo Ayo, El Tolar.

On January 15 2019, In El Alto, protests against the political party of Evo Morales (MAS) were violently removed from the sector by members and followers of MAS. They did not let people in the opposition to talk to media with they had programed for that day. No one was injured in during this event.

On January 14 2019, health workers protested against the implementation of the Unique Health System in La Paz, complaining about the free health program that the government wants to implement.

On January 14 2019, communities and social organizations of Toro Toro protested against the National Service of Protected Areas, regarding the percentage of money that the National Toro Toro park makes that has to be assigned to them. The funds have not been received since 2014, and the protesters demanded this money, saying that it that belongs to the communities surrounding the park.

On 6 December 2018, demonstrators paralyzed activities in different cities in Bolivia. In La Paz, demos were held during the day to reject the resolution of the Supreme Electoral Tribunal of letting Evo Morales run again for president despite the results of the referendum held in February 21. The demos turned violent with rioters and police forces clashing. The police used teargas to disperse the rioters. Additionally, the rioters also fought with different transport workers that were trying to unblock the streets to work.
